text: Liliane Montevecchi (October 13, 1932 – June 29, 2018) was a French-Italian actress, dancer, and singer. She was born in Paris. In 1982 she drew the attention of critics and audiences for her performance in Nine, with Raúl Juliá, for which she won both the Tony and Drama Desk Award for Best Featured Actress in a Musical. Montevecchi died on June 29, 2018 in New York City from colorectal cancer at the age of 85."Tony Winner Liliane Montevececchi Passes Away at 85" broadwayworld.com, June 29, 2018 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Tony Award winning actors Category:Drama Desk Award winners Category:1932 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:French movie actors Category:French television actors Category:French stage actors Category:Singers from Paris Category:French dancers Category:Italian movie actors Category:Italian television actors Category:Italian stage actors Category:Italian singers Category:Actors from Paris
title: Liliane Montevecchi
